title: SEC title? Top one-loss team? Who wins the Heisman? We stack the most interesting races left in the seasonÔªø

title: Source: Bettors allegedly given LeBron injury info
content: Former player Damon Jones was arrested amid charges he allegedly disclosed injury info about Lakers star LeBron James, a source told ESPN, to facilitate illegal betting.

title: Billups, Rozier arrested in gambling investigations
content: Trail Blazers coach Chauncey Billups and Heat guard Terry Rozier have been arrested as part of a pair of investigations related to illegal sports betting and rigged poker games backed by the Mafia, authorities announced.

title: Yesavage to start G1; Jays uncertain on Bichette
content: Blue Jays rookie Trey Yesavage will start Game 1 of the World Series on Friday against the Dodgers, while a decision on activating Bo Bichette has yet to be made.

title: Source: Wings to hire USF's Fernandez as HC
content: The Wings are closing in on hiring longtime South Florida coach Jose Fernandez as their new head coach, a source confirmed to ESPN.

title: Messi, Inter Miami sign extension through 2028
content: Lionel Messi has signed a contract extension to extend his stay at Inter Miami, it has been announced.

title: Wegner named World Series umpire crew chief
content: Mark Wegner will be the World Series umpire crew chief for the first time, joined by Jordan Baker, Adam Hamari, Adrian Johnson, Will Little, Alan Porter and John Tumpane for the matchup between the defending champion Dodgers and Blue Jays.

title: Quad injury sends Titans starting CB Sneed to IR
content: The Titans placed starting cornerback L'Jarius Sneed on injured reserve Thursday, sidelining him for at least the next four games.

title: Marathon record holder gets 3-year doping ban
content: Women's marathon world record-holder Ruth Chepng'etich has been banned for three years after admitting to a doping violation.

content: Real Madrid host Barca in the first Cl√°sico of the season on Sunday. Both teams have plenty of injury concerns.

content: Formula 1 ventures to Mexico City for round 20 of the 2025 season. Find out how the championship shapes up and everything you need to know for the weekend.

title: Leaving IndyCar for F2 sets Colton Herta up for F1 -- if he ever gets the call
content: American Colton Herta is leaving IndyCar to join Formula 2, so if the Cadillac test driver ever gets his shot in F1, he can hit the ground running.

title: Transfer rumors, news: Barcelona keeping tabs on √Ålvarez
content: Barcelona are exploring a possibility to sign Atl√©tico Madrid striker Juli√°n √Ålvarez. Transfer Talk has the latest news and rumors.

title: Fresh Ponzi scam surfaces in West Bengal‚Äôs Asansol, ‚Çπ350 crore siphoned
content: LOP Suvendu Adhikari demanded the arrest of Tahsin Ahmed, the accused behind chit fund scam, return of money of the investors and investigation by SEBI-ED into the money trails.

title: Several including government officers injured in attack in Tripura‚Äôs Surma, Chief Minister blames Tipra Motha supporters.
content: Chief Minister Dr Manik Saha condemned the incident and said the administration has been directed to take swift action against those responsible

title: North Tamil Nadu likely to get intense rainfall from October 26
content: According to the Regional Meteorological Centre, Chennai and its surrounding districts along with Ranipet are likely to receive heavy rainfall between October 26 and 28

title: Around 1,000 doctors, medical staff take part in network hospitals‚Äô strike
content: The total sum to be paid to the network hospitals, which provide free treatments to public under Dr. NTR Vaidya Seva scheme, is around ‚Çπ2,700 crore

title: Bihar voters must choose between NDA‚Äôs¬†vikas¬†and INDIA bloc‚Äôs¬†vinaash: Nadda
content: BJP chief launches sharp attack against alleged corruption by RJD leader Tejashwi Yadav, the CM face of the Opposition alliance; mocks RJD‚Äôs employment promises given land-for-jobs scam case against Mr. Yadav

title: APTF seeks exemption from TET requirement
content: File a review petition in the Supreme Court demanding exemption from the mandatory requirement to pass the test

title: Efforts under way to develop Penuganchiprolu,  Ibrahimpatnam mandals, says official
content: Two mandals among the 500 mandals selected nationwide for overall development, says National Water Mission Director

title: Piyush Goyal hopes for India-U.S. trade deal in ‚Äònear future‚Äô
content: The Union Minister is in Berlin at the moment, following a short trip to Geneva to speak at the 16th session of the United Nations Conference on Trade and Development

title: Unions, farmers unite against drafts of labour policy, Electricity (Amendment) Bill
content: The CTUs and SKM reiterated their resolve to continue coordinated actions to challenge the pro-corporate, anti-worker, and anti-farmer policies of the Central Government

title: Former TTD Chairman receives notices from police
content: Bhumana Karunakar Reddy claims coalition government taking revenge by filing fake cases against him for revealing about the deaths of more than 100 cows at the TTD Goshala

title: Journalist, 54, Hacked To Death By Unidentified Persons In UP: Cops
content: A 54-year-old journalist was hacked to death by unidentified assailants near a hotel here, police said.

title: Trump Says Israel Is "Not Going To Do Anything" With West Bank
content: US President Donald Trump said Wednesday that Israel was "not going to do anything" in the West Bank, after Israeli lawmakers advanced bills paving the way for annexation of the occupied Palestinian territory.

title: Brazil Ex-President Jair Bolsonaro's Son Urges US To Bomb Narco Boats In Rio
content: Brazilian senator Flavio Bolsonaro, son of former far-right president Jair Bolsonaro, on Thursday urged the United States to bomb boats in Rio de Janeiro to fight drug trafficking, as it has done in the Caribbean and Pacific.

title: Readiness 2030: Concerned About Russia, Europe Draws Up Defence Plan
content: European Union leaders on Thursday endorsed a plan to ensure that Europe can defend itself against an outside attack by the end of the decade as concern mounts that Russia is already probing the 27-nation bloc's defences.

title: "Tired" Gazans Count The Cost After Two Years Of War
content: A fragile ceasefire has brought respite to Gazans exhausted by two years of fighting, but even without the daily bombing, they are struggling to live amid the catastrophic destruction wrought by the war.

title: Trump Pardons Binance Founder Zhao After Prison Sentence For Crypto Crimes
content: President Donald Trump has pardoned Binance founder Changpeng Zhao, who created the world's largest cryptocurrency exchange.

title: Railways To Run 1,205 Special Trains Over Next 4 Days To Manage Chhath Rush
content: The government on Thursday said that in addition to the regular train services, 1,205 special trains will operate over the next four days to accommodate the Chhath festival rush.

title: Cochin Shipyard Delivers Mahe, 1st Indigenous Anti-Submarine Vessel To Navy
content: India's push for self-reliance in defence manufacturing gained fresh momentum with the Cochin Shipyard Limited (CSL) delivering Mahe, the first in a series of eight Anti-Submarine Warfare Shallow Water Craft (ASW SWC), to the Indian Navy.

title: Apple Loses $2 Billion UK Lawsuit Over App Store Monopoly
content: Apple lost a UK lawsuit Thursday, which accuses the US tech giant of abusing the dominant position of its App Store, with claimants seeking more than 1.5 billion pounds ($2 billion) in damages.

title: Pakistan Bans Far-Right TLP Again After Deadly Anti-Israel Protests
content: Pakistan on Thursday banned the far-right Islamist party Tehreek-e-Labbaik Pakistan (TLP) under anti-terrorism laws, following deadly clashes during anti-Israel protests near Lahore that left at least five people dead.

title: Assam Eases Population Control Norms For Micro Communities
content: Assam Chief Minister Himanta Biswa Sarma on Thursday indicated the state government is preparing to introduce new bills to ban polygamy and address so-called "love jihad" in the upcoming assembly session.

title: Violence During 24-Hour Tripura Bandh Called To Demand Deportation Of Illegal Migrants
content: The Dhalai district of Tripura turned tense on Thursday evening as a mob supporting the 24-hour statewide strike clashed with police and administration officials.

title: Op Sindoor Showed Navy's Power, Forced Pak To Stay In Harbour: Rajnath Singh
content: The world witnessed the Indian Navy's strength during Operation Sindoor as its deterrent posture forced Pakistan to remain in the harbour or near its coast, Defence Minister Rajnath Singh said on Thursday, hailing the force's combat readiness.

title: Jungle Raj Won't Be Forgotten For 100 Years: PM Modi's Swipe At Bihar Opposition
content: Prime Minister Narendra Modi told the BJP workers in Bihar today that "jungle raj" in Bihar will not be forgotten in another 100 years and asked them to urge the elderly voters of the state to pass down the memories of that time to the younger genera

title: Diwali Bonanza: Delhi Mops Up Rs 600 Crore In Liquor Revenue In 15 Days
content: The Delhi government mopped up about Rs 600 crore in excise revenue from the sale of liquor from retail stores run by its corporations during Diwali, officials said on Thursday.

title: Bangladesh Arrests 8 Andhra Fishermen For Allegedly Straying Into Waters
content: Eight fishermen from Vizianagaram district in Andhra Pradesh have been detained by the Bangladesh Navy after their boat allegedly strayed into neighbouring country's territorial waters, the state government said on Thursday.

title: IPS Officer, Sub Inspector's Wife Trade Harassment, Blackmail Charges In Chhattisgarh
content: A woman has accused IPS officer Ratan Lal Dangi of Chhattisgarh of physical, mental and financial harassment, while the latter has levelled charges of blackmail against her, officials said on Thursday. The woman is the wife of a sub inspector

title: Delhi Cloud Seeding Trial Begins, 1st Rain Experiment Likely On October 29
content: The Delhi government's ambitious artificial rain project took flight today with a successful cloud seeding trial over Burari, marking a major milestone in the capital's battle against pollution.

title: US Stocks Drift, Oil Prices Jump After Trump's "Massive" Russia Sanctions
content: Stocks are drifting on Wall Street, and oil prices are jumping after President Donald Trump announced "massive" new sanctions on Russia's crude industry. The S&P 500 rose 0.1 per cent in the early going on Thursday.

title: Putin Brushes Off Trump's Oil Sanctions, Issues A Tomahawk Warning
content: Russian President Vladimir Putin said on Thursday the latest US sanctions targeting two major oil firms were "serious", but not strong enough to significantly affect the economy.

title: A.P. CM woos UAE investments in petrochemical, energy, food processing sectors
content: Abu Dhabi National Oil Company agrees to develop a clear roadmap for technological collaboration with Andhra Pradesh; Chandrababu Naidu invites UAE industry leaders to the upcoming Partnership Summit in Visakhapatnam

title: Vikassheel Insaan Party‚Äôs Mukesh Sahani: For a former set designer, it‚Äôs the stuff of a Bollywood film
content: Mr. Sahani, who quit the Mahagatbandhan in 2020 alleging ‚Äòbetrayal‚Äô, is now the alliance‚Äôs Deputy Chief Minister face; the move is aimed at garnering maximum votes, especially in North Bihar where the alliance performed poorly 2020

title: Actor Lakshmi Menon petitions HC to quash case against her
content: The court had recently granted anticipatory bail to Ms. Menon and others who had been arraigned as accused in the case that was registered by the Ernakulam North police

title: Kerala government contemplating centralised purchase of cardiac cath lab consumables
content: Plan to purchase consumables for all¬†cath¬†labs in the State‚Äôs public health sector directly from medical devices firms through the Kerala State Medical Services Corporation

title: Manish Sharma appointed new in-charge of Youth Congress
content: The outgoing in-charge of IYC, Krishna Allavaru, is currently the in-charge for party affairs in Bihar, where Assembly elections are to be held

title: DCGI brings in stricter norms for tracking supply chain of high-risk solvents
content: The order, issued earlier this week, comes following serious safety concerns after the alleged death of over 20 children due to contamination of cough syrups with Diethylene Glycol recently in Madhya Pradesh

title: Priyanka warns against shifting Thirunelli Ashram school students to Aralam
content: Scheduled Tribes Development department shifts 32 girls to Kaniyambetta MRS; district administration sets up four bio-toilets at Government Ashram High School, Thirunelli

title: Private drivers of BMTC electric buses stage protest over salary delays
content: The protest is the latest in a series of demonstrations by drivers operating BMTC electric buses under private operators

title: NDA, Mahagatbandhan establish powerful dominance, shrinking space for others
content: Since the 2015 election, the two fronts have been the principal players in Bihar‚Äôs political landscape;¬†the strength and appeal of these formations are such that those who tried their luck independently could not sustain themselves; entry of JSP has triggered talk about a possible end to the duopoly

title: More rain likely in Andhra Pradesh as fresh system brews in the Bay
content: India Meteorological Department predicts heavy to very heavy rain in the State for seven days as a  low-pressure area is likely to form on October 24

title: Bengaluru metro to establish Security Operations Centre to strengthen cyber security
content: Officials said the SOC will serve as a central command hub that continuously monitors, detects, and responds to both cyber and physical security threats

title: Madras High Court takes up suo motu PIL against unauthorised religious structures
content: The case has been taken up to implement orders passed by the Supreme Court against construction of temples, mosques and churches on public roads, streets & parks

title: TTDC names SRM property as Hotel Tamil Nadu unit-II
content: The Tamil Nadu Tourism Development Corporation (TTDC) has taken over the SRM Hotel in Tiruchi, renaming it Hotel Tamil Nadu Unit II, after a 30-year lease with SRM Hotels Pvt Ltd expired due to a Supreme Court ruling over a ‚Çπ20 crore debt

title: Watch: How Tamil Nadu‚Äôs ‚ÄòKalaignar Magalir Urimai Thittam‚Äô is uplifting women | Focus Tamil Nadu
content: In this episode, let‚Äôs look at the Tamil Nadu Government‚Äôs Kalaignar Magalir Urimai Thittam ‚Äî an initiative that‚Äôs reshaping the economic and emotional lives of women. How is this ‚Çπ1,000-a-month basic income changing lives, empowering women, and boosting the local economy?

title: Minor¬†girl¬†sexually assaulted in¬†State hospital¬†in Kolkata;¬†suspect arrested
content: A nurse was assaulted in a district health¬†centre¬†on Wednesday; the State has witnessed a number of  attacks inside medical facilities

title: Andhra Pradesh IT Minister Lokesh invites Australian collaboration in education, technology, tourism and health
content: He appeals to University of Tasmania to help in developing curriculum for pharmacy and paramedical courses, promoting digital health tools, telemedicine, and student‚Äìfaculty exchanges, and conducting joint studies on rural healthcare and water supply

title: Seven new nursing colleges with over 1,500 seats approved after CET counselling
content: KEA completed the mop-up round seat allotment process on September 15, 2025. At that time, a total of 8,808 government quota seats were filled and 1,485 seats remained vacant

title: KLOO app to transform public sanitation in Kerala
content: It aims at creating a Statewide public toilet network, utilising existing clean and accessible facilities in private establishments

title: Nellore, Ongole civic bodies step up relief measures amid heavy rains
content: Ongole Municipal Corporation forms quick response team with 25 members, while Nellore Municipal Corporation deploys sanitation staff to clear rain-related relief activities

title: Amid talk of leadership change, Siddaramaiah's camp floats Satish Jarkiholi‚Äôs name
content: It is seen as a move to checkmate Shivakumar, the top contender for the post, and also send a message to the high command

title: NITI Aayog official and Chief Secretary discuss Purvodaya scheme, Visakhapatnam Growth Hub project
content: Existence of a string of seaports is a major advantage for Andhra Pradesh to achieve significant growth in the maritime sector, says NITI Aayog CEO, and stresses the need for establishment of a container megaport to realise the potential

title: Rain alert continues in Rayalaseema; crop loss ‚Äòunder enumeration‚Äô in Annamayya district
content: Paddy, banana, papaya, and other horticultural crops considerably affected in Rajampeta division, with Railway Kodur, Pullampeta and Chitvel bearing the brunt, according to preliminary reports

title: Pawan calls for opening DLDOs across State from November 1
content: Aim is to ensure the benefits of reforms being implemented in the PR&RD Department reach the people effectively

title: Minority Welfare Minister Farooq releases Class X study material for Urdu medium schools in Andhra Pradesh
content: Developed by the Centre for Educational Development of Minorities, the Minister says the material is designed by experts to support the students‚Äô academic progress

title: Vedan moves Kerala HC, seeking modification of anticipatory bail conditions
content: As per the conditions, the rapper, accused in a sexual abuse case, cannot leave the State without the court‚Äôs permission. He cites stage shows to be held in a few foreign countries in December while seeking change in the conditions

title: Petition submitted to APSPDCL over ‚Çπ40,000-crore alleged corruption in transformer procurement
content: Former IPS officer Venkateswara Rao submits a petition to APSPDCL CMD Siva Sankar Lotheti seeking forensic audit of all transformer procurements since 2019

title: A.P. Chief Secretary calls for cost-effective power procurement strategy
content: Vijayanand directs power utilities to continuously monitor market prices and renewable energy generation trends, and to ensure 24x7 uninterrupted and reliable power supply in the coming months

title: US confirms Trump-Xi meet; Democrats find it 'outrageous' - here's why
content: Amidst a prolonged government shutdown, Democrats are urging President Trump to cancel his upcoming Asia trip, including a meeting with China's Xi Jinping. Critics argue the President should prioritize domestic issues and the suffering of Americans over international diplomacy. Past presidents have canceled foreign travel during similar crises, a precedent Democrats hope Trump will follow.

title: 'Criminal illegal aliens being issued licenses': What WH said on California crash ‚Äî Watch
content: A tragic California crash, claiming three lives, has sparked White House criticism. Press Secretary Karoline Leavitt highlighted that the Indian-origin driver, Jashanpreet Singh, an undocumented immigrant, had been issued a commercial vehicle license by California.  ICE had lodged detainers for Singh, who entered the US in 2022 and was released by the previous administration.

title: Bihar polls: INDIA bloc names Tejashwi as CM face, Mukesh his deputy; asks NDA its choice
content: The INDIA bloc has declared RJD leader Tejashwi Prasad Yadav as its chief ministerial face for Bihar, with VIP president Mukesh Sahani as his deputy. This move aims to unite the alliance ahead of the campaign trail and challenges the NDA to name its leader. The announcement followed days of speculation and internal discussions within the opposition.

title: Tragic! Pak cricketer's newborn baby dies; shares heartbreaking post
content: Pakistan all-rounder Aamir Jamal has announced the tragic passing of his newborn child. The cricketer shared a heartfelt message on social media, accompanied by a photo of his baby's hand. The cricket fraternity and fans have extended their deepest condolences and offered support to Jamal and his family during this incredibly difficult time.

title: Google hits new milestone: CEO Sundar Pichai celebrates; Elon Musk responds
content: Google's Willow chip has achieved a verifiable quantum advantage, running a new algorithm 13,000 times faster than the best supercomputers. This breakthrough, named Quantum Echoes, can explain atomic interactions and paves the way for drug discovery and materials science. The verifiable result marks a significant step towards real-world quantum computing applications.

title: Big twist in Haryana ASI death case: FIR names IAS officer, MLA; wife seeks CBI probe
content: Wife of deceased ASI Sandeep Kumar alleges intense mental stress and harassment from the family of IPS officer Y. Puran Kumar, including his wife IAS officer Amneet P. Kumar and her brother MLA Amit Rattan, drove him to suicide.

title: Women's WC: Pratika-Mandhana centuries fire IND into sems; defeat NZ in must-win clash
content: India secured a dominant 53-run victory over New Zealand via DLS method to reach the 2025 Women's World Cup semifinals. Stellar centuries from Smriti Mandhana and Pratika Rawal, coupled with Jemimah Rodrigues' rapid unbeaten 76, propelled India to a commanding 340/3. New Zealand faltered in their chase, finishing at 271/8.

title: Advice for CEOs: Perplexity CEO on leaderships skills; make peace with some problems
content: Perplexity CEO Aravind Srinivas revealed the crucial leadership skill: accepting imperfections and focusing on the single most important problem. He advocates for launching products at 80% completion, allowing for rapid iteration and market dominance. This strategy enables companies to adapt and grow in the dynamic AI sector by continuously improving.

title: Historic defeat! India fall at Adelaide for first time in 17 years; AUS win series
content: Australia clinched the ODI series 2-0 against India. The hosts' bowlers made early inroads, but Rohit Sharma and Shreyas Iyer built a strong partnership. A late surge from Harshit Rana and Arshdeep Singh helped India post 264. Australia's chase saw steady contributions, with Cooper Connolly playing a key role to seal the victory.

title: GM CEO doubles down: No CarPlay on any car; claims Steve Jobs' vision
content: General Motors is phasing out Apple CarPlay and Android Auto from all its future vehicles, including gasoline models, not just electric ones. CEO Mary Barra confirmed this company-wide strategy, aiming for a more integrated, proprietary infotainment system. This move prioritises data control and potential subscription revenue over customer preference for smartphone projection.

title: Top neurosurgeon explains how dementia may actually start in the legs
content: Early signs of dementia may not always manifest as memory loss but can appear as subtle changes in leg health and walking. Weak leg muscles, reduced walking speed, and altered gait can signal declining brain-body communication and circulation, potentially preceding cognitive issues. Monitoring these physical red flags offers an opportunity for early intervention and improved quality of life.

title: Ayesha Curry once shut down open marriage rumors about her and Stephen Curry
content: Fans are speculating about Stephen Curry's marriage after his wife Ayesha Curry made recent comments on a podcast. She previously defended their relationship against rumors of an open marriage. Curry's remarks about not wanting children or marriage have sparked online debate. The couple has not publicly addressed the current fan reactions.

title: NBA betting scandal: FBI probe widens as more teams, players face arrest
content: The NBA is reeling from an extensive FBI investigation into illegal sports gambling involving players, coaches, and personnel. Several high-profile figures, including Terry Rozier, Chauncey Billups, and Damon Jones, have been arrested for allegedly leaking confidential information and participating in Mafia-linked poker rings. The probe exposes deep ties between professional sports and organized crime, raising serious questions about league integrity.

title: Justin Herbert injury update: Chargers QB cleared to play vs Vikings tonight
content: Los Angeles Chargers quarterback Justin Herbert is set to play against the Minnesota Vikings tonight.  He is not on the injury report.  Herbert has a history of injuries but appears fit.  He spoke about the Vikings' strong defense and their star player Harrison Smith.  The game starts at 5:15 p.m. PDT at SoFi Stadium.

title: Visa effect? Funds sent abroad for studies fall to 8-year low
content: India's outward remittances for overseas education saw a significant 24% year-on-year drop in August 2025, reaching their lowest point since 2017. This decline is attributed to stricter visa norms in popular study destinations and a recalibration of financial decisions by families, leading to a more cautious approach to international education spending.

title: 'Unfriendly act': Putin says Trump's sanctions 'serious'; asserts won't impact 'significantly'
content: Russian President Vladimir Putin acknowledged new US sanctions on the energy sector are serious and will have consequences, but insisted they won't significantly damage the economy. The "unfriendly act" targets Rosneft and Lukoil, aiming to pressure Moscow over the Ukraine conflict. Washington hopes the measures will encourage dialogue, while the Kremlin expresses concern over escalating pressure.

title: Yadavs, Muslims & Bhumihars: How parties are solving Bihar's caste equations - candidate lists decoded
content: Bihar's assembly elections are dominated by caste politics, with parties meticulously crafting manifestos and candidate lists to appeal to traditional voter bases. Despite a recent caste survey highlighting the dominance of backward classes, candidate selections appear to prioritize established loyalties and strategic regional combinations over population-based representation.

title: 100 hospitalised in MP on Diwali: Carbide guns cause eye injuries; most victims children
content: Diwali celebrations turned dangerous in Bhopal and Vidisha as over 100 people, mostly children, were hospitalized due to calcium carbide guns.  These makeshift weapons caused serious eye injuries, with some requiring surgery. Authorities have seized hundreds of guns and detained individuals, despite a prior ban. Families are demanding stricter action against sellers.

title: Surprise pickup! Team IND stars take cab; driver left speechless - watch
content: An Uber driver was left stunned after picking up Indian cricketers Dhruv Jurel, Prasidh Krishna, and Yashasvi Jaiswal for a ride. A viral video captured the driver's disbelief as the players entered his vehicle. The clip, shared widely on social media, amused fans who commented on the driver's speechless reaction to the unexpected celebrity encounter.

title: NC, BJP spar during obituary for Satya Pal Malik; clash over Article 370 role
content: The Jammu and Kashmir Assembly's autumn session began with heated debates over former governor Satya Pal Malik's role in the 2019 Article 370 abrogation during obituary references. NC MLA Bashir Veeri called Malik 'controversial,' sparking a demand for expungement from the BJP, which the Speaker refused. The session concluded with a two-minute silence for the deceased.

title: 'Trump shouldn't tell what India will do': Tharoor slams US President
content: Congress leader Shashi Tharoor has rebuked Donald Trump for announcing India's decisions on Russian oil imports. Tharoor emphasized that India will make its own announcements regarding its energy policy, asserting that New Delhi does not dictate US actions. Trump had claimed India would significantly cut Russian oil purchases by year-end, citing assurances from PM Modi.

title: R Ashwin‚Äôs post sets social media on fire! What does it mean?
content: Ravichandran Ashwin's cryptic social media post featuring Nike's 'Just Leave It' tagline has ignited fan speculation.  Three years after his iconic 'leave' against Pakistan in the T20 World Cup, the post is seen by many as a clever nod to that dramatic moment. Others interpret it as a subtle critique of Team India's recent struggles and senior players' performances.

title: Bihar: Mukesh Sahani emerges as MGB's wildcard; is Congress the weakest link?
content: Tejashwi Yadav has been named the Mahagathbandhan's chief ministerial candidate for Bihar, with Mukesh Sahani as his deputy. This move signals a shift in the alliance's caste dynamics and leadership. However, the Congress faces internal dissent over ticket distribution, raising concerns about its influence within the opposition bloc.

title: JJ McCarthy injury update: Vikings rookie QB ruled out vs Chargers tonight
content: Minnesota Vikings rookie quarterback J.J. McCarthy will not play tonight against the Los Angeles Chargers.  He is still recovering from an ankle sprain.  Veteran Carson Wentz will start for the Vikings.  McCarthy is expected to be the emergency third quarterback.  This decision prioritizes his long-term health.  Fans will have to wait longer to see McCarthy in action.

title: 'Stranger Things Season 5' finale release date: Runtime, when and where to watch the series
content: Get ready for the 'Stranger Things Season 5' finale, potentially hitting AMC theaters and other chains alongside its OTT release. Reports suggest a nearly two-hour runtime, offering a cinematic conclusion to the beloved series. While Netflix hasn't officially confirmed, discussions between industry leaders hint at a big-screen send-off. Expect the trailer soon!

title: 'Act of war': How Russia reacted to Trump's sanction fury
content: Russia has reacted furiously to new US sanctions targeting its oil sector, with former President Dmitry Medvedev labeling the move "an act of war." The sanctions, aimed at crippling funding for the Ukraine invasion, coincide with renewed Russian attacks and a collapse in planned diplomatic talks.

title: Denver Nuggets vs Warriors injury update: Who‚Äôs in, who‚Äôs out for today's game
content: The Denver Nuggets, fully healthy with their star trio, face the Golden State Warriors in a highly anticipated October 23, 2025, matchup. While the Warriors will be without Moses Moody and De'Anthony Melton, Stephen Curry and Jimmy Butler are expected to lead the charge. Denver's depth and clean injury report give them a slight edge against the favored Warriors.

title: Smriti Mandhana shocked, makes U-turn after LBW scare; NZ players in disbelief
content: Smriti Mandhana's spectacular 109 powered Team India to a commanding position in the ICC Women's World Cup 2025. Surviving a tense lbw review, she went on to register her 14th ODI century, forming a record-breaking 212-run opening partnership with Pratika Rawal. Mandhana continues to dominate as the tournament's leading scorer.

title: Trump eases H-1B visa fee, but student caps cloud the future of Indian talent: Here's why
content: The Trump administration‚Äôs decision to ease the $100,000 H-1B visa fee brings relief to thousands of Indian professionals and students already in the US. However, a new cap limiting foreign students to 15% of total university admissions, with no more than 5% from any one country, casts uncertainty over future Indian enrolments and America‚Äôs talent inflow.

title: 'Had no choice': How a job agent duped Hyd man into joining Russian army; family fears for life
content: A Hyderabad man, Mohammed Ahmed, allegedly defrauded by a job agent and sent to Russia, has reportedly signed a one-year contract with the Russian army.  Trapped near the Ukrainian border, Ahmed expressed fear and a lack of choice, pleading for rescue. His family has appealed to the Indian government for his safe return.

title: Terry Rozier arrested in FBI sports betting probe; NBA rocked by scandal
content: Miami Heat guard Terry Rozier was arrested Thursday morning in Orlando as part of a federal investigation into illegal sports betting. The probe is reportedly linked to a 2023 game where unusual betting patterns emerged after Rozier's early exit. This development follows the Jontay Porter scandal and raises further concerns about NBA integrity.

title: 'Illegal immigrant': Indian-origin man arrested after major truck crash kills 3 ‚Äî watch
content: A 21-year-old Indian national, Jashanpreet Singh, faces charges after allegedly causing a fatal crash on Interstate 10 while driving an 18-wheeler under the influence. The incident, which claimed three lives and injured others, highlights concerns over commercial driver licensing for non-citizens. Singh had reportedly entered the US illegally in 2022.

title: Bihar polls: Prashant Kishor targets Tejashwi, takes 'jungle raj' jibe as MGB announces CM face
content: Prashant Kishor, leading the Jan Suraaj Party, critically commented on the Mahagathbandhan's decision to name Tejashwi Yadav as their chief ministerial candidate for the 2025 Bihar elections. He suggested this outcome was predictable given the alliance's history. The opposition bloc formally announced Yadav's candidature, aiming to unite against the NDA.

title: Sikh trucker crashes American dreams of many immigrants from Punjab
content: crash site the TOI correspondent from Washington: The American dream for thousands of Sikh immigrants from India is hanging in the balance following a second fatal trucking accident involving a driver with a controversial immigration history . the driver, Jashanpreet Singh, is reportedly an Indian illegal immigrant who was released from border custody by the Biden administration in 2022 .

title: US court grants Tellis' pre-trial as lawyers say nothing sinister about his China links
content: a court has directed the release of Indian-American scholar Ashley Tellis in a purported espionage case . Tellis' attorneys portrayed the case as a justice department overreach against a patriot whose "scholarly curiosity," not malice, led to benign hoarding of classified documents . the documents were routine work products from his advisory role, they say .

title: Rs 79k crore upgrade! MoD clears mega acquisitions; S-400 missiles among big-ticket buys
content: the defence ministry gave the preliminary nod to a slew of military modernization projects worth around Rs 79,000 crore ($9 billion) the biggest project to get the ‚Äúacceptance of necessity‚Äù from the defence acquisitions council was for the construction of four large amphibious warfare ships or ‚Äúlanding platform docks‚Äù at a cost of Rs 33,000 crore.

title: Bombay HC: Adult woman free to live, marry man of her choice; orders police protection
content:
Rosy Sequeira is special correspondent at The TImes of India, Mumbai
since July 2011. She has covered Bombay High Court for over nine years
which includes her earlier stints with other newspapers. Her forte is
on-the-spot accurate reporting. She tries to bring a human face to the otherwise largely
drab court proceedings and constantly looks out for judicial observations 
that strike a chord with the common man.

title: MP: 300 suffer eye injuries after firing carbide guns; 30 may lose sight
content: as many as 30 of them are said to be serious and could lose their sight . a review meeting was called as soon as we got to know . seven children were seriously injured in Bhopal and admitted in hospital . carbide guns have mixture of calcium carbide, matchstick heads, and gunpowder .

title: Ranking ringless NBA teams by chances to win their first title by 2031
content: the 2014 season was the only seven-year stretch in league history that featured seven unique champions . only two of those seven were true first-time winners . the 2025 Oklahoma City Thunder are technically multitime champions, but the pattern still underscores how much the NBA has been stingy about letting new teams into its championship club.

title: UCL talking points: Conte's rant, Liverpool's best XI, who is Cl√°sico-ready?

Napoli ), Barcelona ( 6-1 v. Olympiacos ), Chelsea and Liverpool ( 5-1 at Eintracht Frankfurt . ESPN writers Mark Ogden, Julien Laurens, Tom Hamilton and Gab Marcotti

title: Wetzel: Sports-betting money is good, but it's not cheap
content: almost every sports league, team and operation wants in on sports wagering revenue . sponsorships, partnerships. advertising. maybe it's direct payments . sports is awash in gambling cash . more than 30 people were arrested, including big shots .

title: Coaching tracker for 2026: Toronto Tempo hire Sandy Brondello
content: the Dallas Wings , New York Liberty and Seattle Storm all cut ties with their head coaches . the expansion Toronto Tempo and Portland Fire joined the WNBA next year . ESPN will track all of the hirings and firings, and provide analysis, as they happen .

title: VUL's Newman keeps drawing complaints and controversy
content: a former coach is accused of using false promises to lure athletes and coaches to a historically black private university in Virginia . he has worked as a football coach and athletic director since 2021 . some of the lawsuit allegations are denied by the university's attorney in a court filing .

title: Experts' picks and best bets: Is anyone taking Ciryl Gane to upset Tom Aspinall?
content: aspinall will make his anticipated return to the Octagon against former interim champion Ciryl Gane on saturday . he owns the UFC record for shortest average fight time at 2 minutes, 2 seconds . the heavyweight is taking on the fourth-mostaccurate heavyweight in UFC history .

title: What we're hearing on the WNBA's CBA negotiations
content: a year ago, the WNBA players' association announced the players would opt out of their current collective bargaining agreement with the league that was set to expire following the 2025 season . the players outlined their desire for a new economic model based on equity . there are no signs a deal will be put in place by the date that the current deal expires, on Oct. 31 .

title: What if Ohtani WAS on that plane to Toronto? Inside an alternate World Series universe
content: Shohei Ohtani and Vladimir Guerrero will be at the plate for the 2025 world series . there is another world, one not as far-fetched as you might think . Roki Sasaki could be playing the part of rookie sensation for the Blue Jays .

title: Who will win Dodgers-Blue Jays World Series? MLB scouts, execs and managers make their predictions
content: the Toronto Blue Jays host the los Angeles Dodgers in Game 1 on friday . the 2025 world series is nearly upon us . what should you expect from the team's pitching staff? which X factors will determine this October's last team standing?
